  "title": "Procurement & Logistics Officer",
  "description": "Tokiye Integrated Medical Service was created to address the critical needs in healthcare project management with an emphasis on effective and efficient service delivery. The company is driven by a passion for excellence and a commitment to professional service, aiming to elevate Nigeria&rsquo;s healthcare system to international standards.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement &amp; Logistics Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Uyo, Akwa Ibom

Role Summary


	The Procurement and Logistics Officer will support the end-to-end procurement, transportation, and distribution of project materials and equipment for the project.
	The role will ensure that goods are sourced cost-effectively, and transported efficiently, and distributed promptly to the project site, maintaining 100% compliance with company standards, regulations, and project timelines.


Key&nbsp;&nbsp;Responsibilities&nbsp;
Procurement Support and Sourcing:


	Assist in sourcing, evaluating, and selecting suppliers for construction materials, medical equipment, and consumables.
	Obtain and compare quotations to ensure cost efficiency, quality, and timely delivery.
	Liaise with the head of procurement to prepare purchase orders (POs) and ensure adherence to company procurement policies and approval limits.
	Maintain up-to-date vendor and price lists for frequently purchased items.
	Liaise with suppliers to confirm delivery schedules and resolve any supply delays or quality issues.


Logistics and Transportation Management:


	Coordinate the transportation and movements of materials and equipment.
	Support freight and forwarding processes, ensuring compliance with Nigerian Customs and other relevant authorities.
	Plan and coordinate local deliveries to the project site.


Warehouse and Distribution Alignment:


	Work closely with the Inventory Supervisor to synchronize inbound and outbound material movements.
	Ensure all deliveries are accurately received, recorded, and transferred to the site warehouse.
	Monitor distribution schedules to ensure materials reach work fronts on time.
	Support proper documentation of materials received and issued for transparency and audit readiness.


Documentation and Compliance:


	Maintain comprehensive records of purchase orders, delivery notes, invoices, and customs clearance documentation.
	Ensure 100% compliance with company procurement procedures, ethical sourcing, and regulatory requirements.
	Prepare weekly procurement and logistics status reports for project management review.
	Support audit processes and maintain complete traceability of all transactions.


Coordination and Communication:


	Collaborate with the procurement, finance, inventory, and construction teams to align purchasing with project priorities.
	Provide regular logistics updates to the line manager and identify potential supply chain risks.
	Support vendor and freight partner relationship management to ensure dependable service delivery.


Requirements / Qualifications


	Education:&nbsp;
	
		Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree preferably in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field.
		Candidates without a related degree must have proven, relevant experience (7 years) in procurement, logistics, or supply chain operations for major construction or industrial projects.
	
	
	Experience:
	
		7&nbsp;years of procurement and logistics experience, preferably in construction, healthcare, or infrastructure projects.
	
	
	Strong negotiation, vendor management, and contract administration skills.
	Proficiency in ERP/procurement systems and logistics tracking tools.
	Excellent organizational, analytical, and communication skills.
	High integrity, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple priorities under pressure.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong understanding of the end-to-end supply chain (procurement, logistics, warehousing, distribution).
	Ability to coordinate with multiple stakeholders (suppliers, freight forwarders, warehouse, site teams).
	High data accuracy and documentation discipline.
	Effective problem-solving and risk mitigation skills.
	Team-oriented and proactive mindset, working collaboratively under supervision and tight deadlines.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hro.iih@tokiyemed.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Network Engineer Job at Layer3




        
    

        
        Layer3 is a fun and innovative place to work – a leader in Cloud, Security, Network and Data center solutions in Nigeria. We are one of the few companies in Africa to have attained all three global security standard certifications namely ISO 27001, ISO 27017 and PCI-DSS. We were listed by the London Stock Exchange Group’s ‘Companies to Inspire Africa 2019’ report in 2018 as well as, by Jobberman as one of the Top ICT companies to work for in Nigeria. We have a superb work culture with strong values. We are passionate about building a great company with a generation of future leaders and a team of professionals that are changing the world.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Our positive work environment inspires all Layerons to live their dreams and be the best they can be. This coupled with our passion for excellence, world class technology solutions and global partners, help us fulfil our mission which is to make our customers’ businesses more successful.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Engineer 

Job Locations: Lagos
Job Type: Full-Time
Grade level: Mid level

Job Summary


	Network Engineer will also be responsible for planning, directing and coordinating activities required to fulfil and support network services to enterprise customers.
	These include the management of existing and development of new network infrastructure systems, as well as managing system and network administration.


Job Responsibilities


	Extensive hands-on engineering level support on switching and routing technologies such as BGP, OSPF, MPLS/VPLS, spanning tree protocols e.g.; MSTP, RSTP, 802.1x, 802.11, 802.16, VPN, DMVPN, SDN, VRRP/HSRP, WAN Acceleration, QoS, VoIP, VTC, cloud, Automation and similar network technologies.
	Ability to analyze and troubleshoot network communications failures and bottlenecks.
	Ability to analyze system logs, identifying potential issues and troubleshooting any reported network problems
	Switching tasks include VTP, ISL/ 802.1q, IPSec and GRE Tunneling, VLANs, Ether Channel, Trunking, Port Security, STP and RSTP.
	Configuration of LAN/WAN/WLAN links using VSI/ L2VC, for MPLS L2VPN will be required to be available for on-call duties on a need basis.
	Understands and assist in technical strategies in the design, configuration and maintenance of LAN, WAN and wireless networks to ensure the stability, integrity and operational effectiveness and efficiency of network services.
	Participates in the design and configuration of internal and/or external networks as required for assigned projects.
	Supervise IP/MPLS services’ implementation covering the installations, testing & handover.
	Proactively perform corrective maintenance for IP/MPLS network.
	Develop automation and other internal systems and tools to assist in the care and feeding of the IP/MPLS network and integration activities.
	Responsible for network planning, configuration, and implementation.
	Design and develop routing topology for Core /Access/Metro/Edge network infrastructures and for converged data & communications services and their successful integration.
	Drive Digital Transformation Agenda using Cloud, Security, Big-Data, IOT, SDN, SDS, SDWAN, and SDWAN
	Responding to RFQ & preparing proposals.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology or related field or its equivalent.
	4 to 6 years of relevant experience in troubleshooting and managing IP networks.
	Hands on experience in Cisco, Juniper, Fortigate, Bluecoat is required.
	A thorough understanding of network technology and protocols.
	Operating systems knowledge.
	Advanced knowledge in cabling structured network.
	Possess high level interpersonal communication skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications: careers@layer3.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	Our interview process at Layer3 is a multi-stage process. This process is designed to for us to know you better and how well you fit into the Layer3 culture. We are eager to meet you.
	Only qualified candidates would be contacted.
